intro: Muraltia salteri, commonly known as the Salter's muraltia, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, and produces small, fragrant white or pink flowers. Its botanical features make it an important species in its native ecosystems, supporting local biodiversity. Due to its ornamental value, it is also cultivated in gardens in warmer climates.
